newsitem.title: USA: United HealthCare signs 10-year AARP deal.
newsitem.headline: United HealthCare signs 10-year AARP deal.

text.p: United HealthCare Corp said Thursday it completed a 10-year contract to provide Medicare supplement insurance and develop new products for the American Association of Retired Persons (AARP).

Terms of the contract, which begins January 1, 1998, were not disclosed. But United Healthcare said that its portion of AARP insurance offerings represents more than $3.8 billion in revenue and 5.1 million policyholders, according to 1996 figures.
United Healthcare began negotiations with AARP last September.
In addition to the completed contract, the company said AARP started discussions with United Healthcare to provide managed health care plans in five markets, and those talks continue.
